data.text: Multiday handlebars!
data.author: Ignacio Duran

data.text: As my handlebars on my recumbent are close to the same as any other bike I have no need of changing them to accommodate comfort. I hold the bars in two positions but as I no longer have any body weight on my hands there is little need for constant changing of hand positions as I once did on the diamond frame drop bars.
data.author: Bob Loblawb

data.text: If you get drop bars it‚Äôs worth getting the proper width. I had some that were too long and it caused a lot of shoulder pain on long rides.

data.text: Salsa Cowbell.

data.text: Drop
data.author: Brandon Howlett

data.text: I've tried several bar types before, drop bars, trekking bars, flat bars with bar ends. My favorite has been alt bars with bar ends. They are a squiggly swept back bar with a slight rise up by the stem. It has a traditional set up so that its easy to use a handlebar bag. Though I will say the moloko bars seem enticing to me.

data.author: Carter AL

data.text: I had my Co-Motion switched to mountain handle bars when I bought it. More stable, I use it as a cyclocross bike too. Plus I prefer mountain drive trains. Very durable with low gearing for steep heavily loaded climbs.

data.text: I like the bendy ones.

data.text: I have two different bikes... One road bike and one mountain bike with butterfly handlebar

data.text: We ride mostly road and 80+ miles a day. Drop bars. The one on my Surly Disc Trucker have a lift prior to going into the drops.
data.author: Dan Hurley

data.text: I'll put a good word in for butterfly handlebars... lots of alternatives for where to put your hands I've always found them confortable
data.author: Nick Andrew

data.text: Really liking this Blendr setup on my Trek with a riser bar. A quill with built in adjustable stem. Up/down, back/forth, with a riser to spin and adjust for angle. So often there is no perfect position, and I just need change on a long trip. Change it in a couple of minutes with an allen key.
data.author: Pedaling Pete
Paula Termini

data.text: I have drops because I like to get low in the wind, however I am really starting to consider some H Bars.
